As Mike Mamolen looped around College Avenue late Friday night his eyes scanned the road and sidewalks for swerving vehicles and drunken pedestrians PERIOD

After all in his eight years on the force Mamolen a State College Police Department officer said he has pretty much seen it all PERIOD Almost nothing shocks him anymore he said PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

Mamolen estimated that in his career he has made m ore than  arrests including about  for driving under the influence PERIOD

Recently the State College Borough Council has discussed the idea of asking Penn State for more compensation to fund the boroughs police department PERIOD

 Borough Council President Cathy Dauler said PERIOD 

The State College Police Department concerned with the percent of crime that is alcoholfueled has been tracking downtown incidents since  State College Police Lt PERIOD

Dana Leonard said PERIOD So far the tracking has shown that half to twothirds of downtown crime was related to alcohol he said PERIOD

Mamolen sees these statistics in action every time he is on nighttime duty PERIOD

 Mamolen said PERIOD 

Mamolen said the highest BAC he has seen was a . pERIOD The legal limit to drive in Pennsylvania is . pERIOD

Arresting at least one intoxicated student or driver has become commonplace for Mamolen who usually works the  p.m PERIOD to  a.m PERIOD shift Wednesday through Saturday PERIOD

Friday was no exception PERIOD

At  a.m. Mamolen responded to a call that a car had struck a tree near the corner of East Irvin Avenue and Garner Street PERIOD When he arrived another officer was already on the scene talking to the driver whose gray BMW had jumped the curb leveled a noparking sign and came to rest in front of a tree PERIOD

Mamolen and the other police officer questioned the driver and administered a series of field sobriety tests PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

The driver could not take two steps along the white crosswalk line without stumbling PERIOD Mamolen then arrested the man for suspicion of DUI and another police officer took him to Mount Nittany Medical Center PERIOD

Mamolen added that the mans BMW would probably be impounded PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

Leonard said the State College Police Department works closely with the Penn State University Police when dealing with alcohol abuse PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

Even though Mamolen has to deal with a lot of intoxicated students he said he likes being a police officer because every day on the job is different PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

Even on a night like Friday with gusty wind and temperatures that hovered in the midteens droves of students ventured out to bars and fraternity parties PERIOD Mamolens scanner started a steady stream of calls around midnight PERIOD

Dauler said the borough has to concentrate on continuing to protect the community PERIOD

 she said PERIOD 

Penn State provides State College with financial support policies and personnel to contain the problem Dauler said PERIOD

 she said PERIOD 

For members of the State College Police Department such as Mamolen this means trying to keep the streets safer PERIOD

Around  a.m PERIOD Mamolen answered a call to a house on the  block of South Pugh Street for attempted burglary PERIOD

However the  turned out to be a lost drunk PERIOD

Mamolen and two other officers arrived within seconds of the call and five minutes later they emerged with a young man in handcuffs PERIOD

 he said PERIOD

The suspect said he was visiting friends at Penn State and didnt know where he was PERIOD Mamolen called an ambulance to pick the suspect up for a possible 

However not everyone who appears to be intoxicated is stopped by police PERIOD

Mamolen said driving a car fighting or disturbing the peace while drunk will usually lead to an arrest but those who are simply staggering or stumbling on their way home will usually be left alone PERIOD

 he said PERIOD

Council member Elizabeth Goreham said she thinks Penn State needs to do a better job of battling alcohol abuse instead of just pushing students to drink less PERIOD

She added that students need to face more consequences from Penn State for offcampus drinking PERIOD

 Goreham said PERIOD 

Over the course of the night Mamolen responded to other situations that dealt with alcohol in one way or another  a noise complaint in an apartment complex at  E PERIOD College Ave at  p.m. a call to check a possible fake ID at the AllAmerican Rathskeller  S PERIOD Pugh Street at  p.m PERIOD At  a.m. he broke up a fight between two females who were yelling obscenities at each other along College Avenue PERIOD

Mamolen said he keeps a sense of humor while at work    but that a lot of the alcoholrelated incidents he deals with daily are no joke PERIOD
